channel.title: What'ya reckon
channel.description: [url=http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=FS-077-OE&groupid=43&catid=1270&subcat=]http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=FS-077-OE&groupid=43&catid=1270&subcat=[/url] Im thinking of buying this PC,with the optional GTX 260, and was wondering what you guys think, specifications below Warranty: 1 Year Onsite Collect & Return Warranty Other: Arctic Silver 5 heatsink compound professionally hand installed by our technicians Sound Card: 7.1 High Definition OnBoard Sound Card Processor Cooler: Akasa AK-967 Nero Direct Contact Heatpipe CPU Cooler Processor: Intel Core i7 920 2.66Ghz D0 Overclocked to 3.40GHz! Power Supply Corsair: TX 650W ATX2.2 SLI Compliant PSU Optical Drive: LG GGC-H20L Blu-Ray Reader & HD-DVD ROM Serial ATA Drive Motherboard: Gigabyte EX58-UD3R Intel X58 (Socket 1366) PCI-Express DDR3 Motherboard Memory: Corsair XMS3 6GB (3x2GB) DDR3 PC3-12800C9 (1600MHz) Tri-Channel Hard Drive: Seagate Barracuda 7200.12 1TB SATA-II 32MB Cache Graphics Card: Nvidia 3D Vision Enabled Graphics Card (GTX 260) Case Performance Gaming Case Options (coolermaster elite 355) and im thinking of getting this monitor http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=MO-111-SA&groupid=17&catid=948&subcat= you reckon its worth it? the price on that PC isnt the price im going to be paying mind you because im having the GTX 260 which i an extra £43 total: Monitor: £129.98 PC: £861.96 inc VAT (including the GTX 260) £991.94

item.title: What'ya reckon
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:2, topic:296127”]its nice, but you should go for the GTX275 (20-30$ more) and gives more power than the GTX280 (275 was made to compete with low prices that AMD’s 4890 offered) 260 is a rip off atm[/quote]I agree. My GTX 275 makes me cum buckets.

item.title: What'ya reckon
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=FS-077-OE&groupid=43&catid=1270&subcat=
Im thinking of buying this PC,with the optional GTX 260, and was wondering what you guys think, specifications below
Warranty: 1 Year Onsite Collect & Return Warranty
Other: Arctic Silver 5 heatsink compound professionally hand installed by our technicians
Sound Card: 7.1 High Definition OnBoard Sound Card
Processor Cooler: Akasa AK-967 Nero Direct Contact Heatpipe CPU Cooler
Processor: Intel Core i7 920 2.66Ghz D0 Overclocked to 3.40GHz!
Power Supply Corsair: TX 650W ATX2.2 SLI Compliant PSU
Optical Drive: LG GGC-H20L Blu-Ray Reader & HD-DVD ROM Serial ATA Drive
Motherboard: Gigabyte EX58-UD3R Intel X58 (Socket 1366) PCI-Express DDR3 Motherboard
Memory: Corsair XMS3 6GB (3x2GB) DDR3 PC3-12800C9 (1600MHz) Tri-Channel
Hard Drive: Seagate Barracuda 7200.12 1TB SATA-II 32MB Cache
Graphics Card: Nvidia 3D Vision Enabled Graphics Card (GTX 260)
Case Performance Gaming Case Options (coolermaster elite 355)
and im thinking of getting this monitor
http://www.overclockers.co.uk/showproduct.php?prodid=MO-111-SA&groupid=17&catid=948&subcat=
you reckon its worth it? the price on that PC isnt the price im going to be paying mind you because im having the GTX 260 which i an extra £43
total: Monitor: £129.98
PC: £861.96 inc VAT (including the GTX 260)
£991.94
